thread.title: New Zealand cyclist Hayden Roulston back on track with gold at Oceania champs
thread.title_full: New Zealand cyclist Hayden Roulston back on track with gold at Oceania champs

author: Scott Donaldson
title: New Zealand cyclist Hayden Roulston back on track with gold at Oceania champs
text:
New Zealand cyclist Hayden Roulston back on track with gold at Oceania champs SCOTT DONALDSON Last updated 20:33, October 9 2015 DIANNE MANSON / GETTY IMAGES 
New Zealand's Hayden Roulston overtakes Nick Yallouris in the Elite Men 4000m Individual Pursuit. 
New Zealand cyclist Hayden Roulston has won a gold medal in the individual pursuit at the Oceania Track Cycling Championships in Invercargill, in his first competitive track cycling event since winning two Olympic Games medals in 2008. 
The individual pursuit rider qualified fastest for the four-kilometre final and continued his good form to win a gold medal by just 0.3 seconds against Australia's Rohan Wight, with a time of 4:27.552 to go with his team pursuit gold medal from day one of the championships.
